name: Top Movies of 1997 Online Trivia | Movies by Year | 10 Questions

questions.text: One of Martin Scorsese's most provocative and beautifully filmed works was released to the public in 1997.  Featuring the coming-of-age story of the 14th Dalai Lama, the film is evocative of so many emotions.  What is its title?
questions.explanation:
Kundun.

	'Kundun' features the acting of an almost entirely non-professional Tibetan cast (with the exception of the bit Chinese parts, which are played by professional actors).  The role of the Dalai Lama is played by four young men of varying ages. Not surprisingly, the movie was shot in Morocco, not Tibet.  Scorsese was banned from Tibet after the film was issued to the public.

questions.text: Featuring Jack Nicholson as a neurotic writer, Helen Hunt as a struggling waitress and Greg Kinnear as an unfortunate artist, which film of 1997 meandered its way through the lives of these three people?
questions.explanation:
As Good as It Gets.

	For their acting efforts in the film, Nicholson and Hunt both won Academy Awards.  Kinnear was also nominated, but did not win.  Interestingly, the two Oscars for Best Actor and Best Actress were the only ones garnered for the film.

questions.text: One of the best films of 1997 was 'Amistad', the story of a shipful of Africans who, after having been illegally seized and submitted to the slave trade, forcibly commandeered the ship upon which they were being transported.  Who ably directed this fascinating film?
questions.explanation:
Steven Spielberg.

	Perhaps the best part of 'Amistad' happened to be the acting, particularly the efforts of Djimon Hounsou as Cinque and Anthony Hopkins as John Quincy Adams, the former U.S. president.  Spielberg was even able to convince former U.S. Supreme Court Justice Harry Blackmun to appear as Associate Justice Joseph Story in the film!

questions.text: Directed by Mike Newell, this film features Johnny Depp as an FBI agent who has infiltrated the Mafia hierarchy.  Unfortunately, the Depp character becomes personally involved with his 'case', especially in his friendship with Lefty Ruggiero, played by Al Pacino.  Which film is described here?
questions.explanation:
Donnie Brasco.

	You really can't go wrong when you cast Johnny Depp and Al Pacino.  Add supporting players Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby and Anne Heche and you have yourself a cinematic gem.  Ably directed by Mike Newell, the film is based on the book by Joe Pistone, the real life 'Donnie Brasco'.

questions.text: Though he had been directing films for over a decade, it was this film, directed by Wong Kar-Wai in 1997, about the unhappy relationship between two gay men from Hong Kong that won him international acclaim.  What is the English language title of Wong's 'Cheun Gwong Tsa Sit'?
questions.explanation:
Happy Together.

	'Happy Together' works not only because of the direction of Wong, but also as a result of the acting chemistry of the film's two leads, Leslie Cheung and Tony Leung, two of Hong Kong's most acclaimed thespians.

questions.text: In the follow up to his masterful 'Pulp Fiction', Quentin Tarantino tells the story of a struggling flight attendant who gets herself involved with the owner of a bail bonds outfit in an undercover plot to bust a small time crime boss named Ordell Robbie.  What is the title of this thrilling little film?
questions.explanation:
Jackie Brown.

	Pam Grier, of 70s 'blaxploitation' fame, plays the title role in this film.  Alongside her is featured Robert Forster as the very low-key Max Cherry, bail bondsman.  The cast also features Samuel Jackson as the creepy Ordell Robbie, Robert De Niro as the burnout criminal Louis Gara, Bridget Fonda as surfer, wastoid Melanie and Michael Keaton as ATF agent Ray Nicolette.  In addition, check out one of Chris Tucker's over-the-top performance as the junkie Beaumont Livingston.

questions.text: For many, the best film of 1997 was 'L.A. Confidential', which featured a marvelous ensemble cast.  Which of the following actors was not among those appearing in the film?
questions.explanation:
Viggo Mortensen.

	In what might be considered a 'Neo-Noir', director Curtis Hanson was able to assemble one of the best film casts ever.  Aside from Crowe, Spacey and Pearce, Danny DeVito and James Cromwell also appeared.  Topping them all was the performance of Kim Basinger as Lynn Bracken, a role for which she received an Oscar.

questions.text: For those of us into the truly disturbing and bizarre, we need look no further than this 1997 film, featuring a montage of scenes weaving in and out of the lives of teenagers and children who have apparently survived a tornado hit in their tiny Ohio town of Xenia.  What is the title of this very unusual, independent film directed by Harmony Korine?
questions.explanation:
Gummo.

	Warning: 'Gummo' is not for the faint of heart.  If you are not so easily disturbed, I strongly recommend checking out this strange film featuring Chloë Sevigny, among a cast of mostly unknowns.  The oddball imagery in this film is quite surreal.  Surprisingly most of the lines in the film were indeed scripted.

questions.text: An animated masterpiece of almost unsurpassed beauty, 'Princess Mononoke' first hit theaters in 1997.  What is the name of the acclaimed Japanese film director who conjured up this grand fantasy-adventure?
questions.explanation:
Hayao Miyazaki.

	'Princess Mononoke' is one of many animated films that has emerged from the imagination of the great Miyazaki.  The Japanese film title, 'Mononoke Hime', literally translates as 'Princess Angry Spirit'.  What angers Mononoke is that the environment is being destroyed by human intervention, a common theme in the works of Miyazaki.  I implore you to have a look at this and other films by Miyazaki if you have not already.

questions.text: The final film in this 'top ten' comes from the mind of director David Fincher.  In the film, Nicholas Van Orton, played by Michael Douglas, finds himself involved in a harrowing adventure as he is immersed in a terrifying real-life/virtual-reality 'game' as a gift from his brother.  What is the title of imaginative thriller?
questions.explanation:
The Game.

	Sean Penn appears as the brother of Michael Douglas in the film.  Great combination! I hope you enjoyed this quiz as much as I enjoyed making it.  Thank you for playing.
